winner.name: Mickey
winner.legacy: Quiet threat who peaked at the end

placements.name: Mickey
placements.notes: Won FTC via tiebreak (3–3–2 initial; Ryan breaks tie for Mickey) — 4 votes to win • 2 challenge wins • 2 immunity wins • 0 votes against • 0 votes against all season (perfect game)

placements.name: Sky
placements.notes: 3 votes to win • 4 challenge wins • 3 immunity wins • 1 votes against

placements.name: Ryan
placements.notes: 2 votes to win + cast's deciding winner vote • 1 challenge wins • 1 immunity wins • 7 votes against • Fan Favorite

placements.name: Scarlett
placements.notes: Lost fire-making • 2 challenge wins • 2 immunity wins • 2 votes against

placements.name: Dave
placements.notes: 3–3★ vote (idol play flipped outcome against him) • 2 challenge wins • 1 immunity wins • 5 votes against

placements.name: Josee
placements.notes: 6★–5 vote (KIP theft + idol chaos round) • 5 votes against • KIP/advantage chaos round

winner.name: Mickey
winner.description: Won with structure + threat management; 0 votes against all season and sealed a 3–3–2 FTC tie by earning Ryan’s deciding tiebreak vote.

fanFavorite.name: Ryan
fanFavorite.description: Most visible merge/endgame presence; made FTC and became the kingmaker in the 3–3–2 finale.

bestStrategic.name: Scarlett
bestStrategic.description: Strongest long-game strategist; navigated swap/merge blocs and reached Final 4, only falling at fire-making.

bestSocial.name: Mickey
bestSocial.description: Quietly decisive social game—overlap relationships kept votes from ever consolidating on him; Ryan chose him over Sky in the final tiebreak.

bestPhysical.name: Sky
bestPhysical.description: Season’s top competitor: 4 total challenge wins and 3 immunity wins; dominated the late-game power window.

mostClutch.name: Sky
mostClutch.description: Closed hard late (F6–F4) with immunity streak + the season’s most outcome-changing idol play at Final 6.

mostLoyal.name: Ryan
mostLoyal.description: Stayed locked with Mickey through the crucial stretch and proved it when he cast the deciding winner vote.

bestUnderdog.name: Sugar
bestUnderdog.description: Took the most heat (10 votes against) and still pushed to Final 5—survived as the default boot through constant plan rewrites.

biggestVillain.name: Blaineley
biggestVillain.description: Weaponized chaos and advantages to stay alive from the bottom; her presence kept the game in paranoia mode.

mostChaotic.name: Blaineley
mostChaotic.description: Major blowups, constant heat, and chaos math—forced the entire merge to adapt around her.

quietestThreat.name: Mickey
quietestThreat.description: Never had a real danger round; stayed positioned as a “safe ally” while quietly being the winning structure.

seasonMVP.name: Sky
seasonMVP.description: The season’s biggest momentum swings ran through her immunity dominance and the Final 6 idol decision that reshaped the endgame.

biggestMeltdown.name: Scarlett
biggestMeltdown.description: Final 4 meltdown right before the fire-making gate—worst timing when calm execution mattered most.

mostTragic.name: Dave
mostTragic.description: Had real win equity late, but Sky’s idol flipped the plan and made him the clean pivot boot at Final 6.

mostUnlucky.name: Josee
mostUnlucky.description: Had an idol, then Knowledge Is Power stripped it at the worst moment; followed by a failed Shot in the Dark.

messiestFeud.name: Dave vs Sugar
messiestFeud.description: Season-long strategic anchor feud; every merge vote had to account for whether they could coexist another round.

biggestBetrayal.description: Not a sudden backstab—Mickey slowly replaced the early Lulu core (Dave/Mickey) with the endgame axis (Mickey/Ryan).

ironPerson.name: Mickey
ironPerson.description: Never looked on the ropes—stable through swap, merge, and endgame without panic rounds or visible survival scrambles.

legacy.summary: Introduced 18 new players (Gen 3) and a Survivor-style twist gauntlet (3 tribes, swap, split-tribal merge round, vote-loss twists, and Final 4 fire-making). Mickey won with 0 votes against and survived a 3-3-2 FTC tie thanks to Ryan's deciding tiebreak vote — proving that clean positioning and relationships can beat pure challenge dominance.
memorableMoments: Only 3–3–2 Final Tribal tie in the franchise; Ryan breaks it
Mickey wins with 0 votes against (perfect game)
Josee’s 6–5 chaos tribal with KIP theft + idol madness
Sky leads the season in challenge wins (4) and immunities (3)
Auction twist and journey vote-loss shake the merge
